A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Long-time Star Wars fan\, but was very disappointed with this installment. Luke’s character was destroyed\, reduced to a petty cry baby who just kind of dies as the end. Such a shame to bastardize one of the most formative protagonists in film history. All the questions from Force Awakens were answered\, but not in a satisfying way. Luke a deadbeat runaway\, that’s the best you could do? And to make it worse\, the movie ends with zero connection to an Episode 9. You literally don’t need 9; there are no cliffhangers\, nothing to build on. In conclusion\, the writer seemed more concerned to play toward our nostalgia than develop a compelling story. He had all the tools\, but failed to put them to good use.
